content.en: Mesh generation algorithms: Researchers have been exploring various algorithms to address different challenges in generating high-quality meshes for scientific simulations. These algorithms, such as mesh motion, advancing front method, and Delaunay refinement, are designed to improve the generation of tetrahedral and hexahedral meshes with specific characteristics, such as anisotropy, adaptivity, and quality measures. By incorporating these algorithms into grid-based or density-based approaches, scientists aim to generate more efficient and accurate meshes for a wide range of applications, from computational fluid dynamics to material simulations.
content.da: Mesh-genereringsalgoritmer: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige algoritmer for at tage højde for forskellige udfordringer ved generering af højkvalitets-meshes til videnskabelige simulationer. Disse algoritmer, såsom mesh motion, advancing front-metoden og Delaunay-raffinement, er designet til at forbedre genereringen af tetraedrale og hexaedrale meshes med specifikke egenskaber såsom anisotropi, adaptivitet og kvalitetsmålinger. Ved at inkorporere disse algoritmer i grid-baserede eller densitetsbaserede tilgange, sigter forskerne mod at generere mere effektive og nøjagtige meshes til en bred vifte af anvendelser, fra beregningsfluiddynamik til materialesimulationer.
